meanings.definition: The placement of an enclitic before the word to which it is attached.
meanings.sent1: In proclisis, the enclitic comes before the main word.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study proclisis to understand word attachment.
meanings.sent3: The grammar book made a joke about proclisis, saying the enclitic likes to be fashionably early.
meanings.sent4: Proclisis is like a polite guest who enters the room before the host.
meanings.sent5: Remember proclisis by picturing the enclitic stepping in front of the main word.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of a word being pronounced with a stress on the first syllable.
meanings.sent1: The proclisis of 'record' emphasizes the first syllable.
meanings.sent2: English speakers may not notice proclisis in everyday speech.
meanings.sent3: The teacher exaggerated the proclisis of 'banana' to make a point.
meanings.sent4: Proclisis can make a simple word sound dramatic.
meanings.sent5: Practice proclisis by stressing the first syllable of different words.
